doc:
Tuesday Weld https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuesday_Weld 0 Tuesday Weld (born Susan Ker Weld; August 27, 1943) is an American actress. She began acting as a child, and progressed to mature roles in the late 1950s. She won a Golden Globe Award for Most Promising Female Newcomer in 1960. Over the following decade she established a career playing dramatic roles in films. Her work, often as a featured performer in supporting roles, was acknowledged with nominations for a Golden Globe Award for Play It as It Lays (1972), a nomination for Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for Looking for Mr. Goodbar (1977), an Emmy Award for The Winter of Our Discontent (1983), and a BAFTA for Once Upon a Time in America (1984). Since the late 1980s, her acting appearances have been infrequent. Tuesday_Weld ( born Susan_Ker_Weld ; August_27_,_1943 ) is an_American_actress . She began_acting as a_child , and progressed_to_mature roles in the_late_1950s . She won a_Golden_Globe_Award for Most_Promising_Female_Newcomer in 1960 . Over the_following_decade she established a_career playing dramatic_roles in films . Her_work , often as a_featured_performer in supporting_roles , was_acknowledged with nominations for a_Golden_Globe_Award for Play It as It Lays (_1972_) , a_nomination for Academy_Award for Best Supporting_Actress for Looking for Mr._Goodbar ( 1977_) , an_Emmy_Award for The_Winter of Our_Discontent_(_1983_) , and a_BAFTA for Once Upon a_Time in America_(_1984_) . Since the_late_1980s , her_acting_appearances have_been infrequent .
